intro: Floscopa elegans, commonly known as the elegant floscopa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and blue. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
